channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TIKA-2861] MP4Parser not getting gps metadata
item.description: Hello, MP4Parser is not getting video GPS metadata which is extracted for images such as jpeg. I have checked both MP4 and MOV files, the files I checked all have GPS Exif data embedded in the same fields as image. Any idea? Thanks!

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: any chance you could share an example file?
Thanks for the reply Tim. Please see the file attached. 1.mp4

I have tried the latest Tika, it is getting these:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta name="date" content="2019-03-29T04:36:39Z"/>
<meta name="X-Parsed-By" content="org.apache.tika.parser.DefaultParser"/>
<meta name="X-Parsed-By" content="org.apache.tika.parser.mp4.MP4Parser"/>
<meta name="meta:creation-date" content="2019-03-29T04:36:39Z"/>

<meta name="tiff:ImageLength" content="1080"/>
<meta name="resourceName" content="1.mp4"/>
<meta name="dcterms:created" content="2019-03-29T04:36:39Z"/>
<meta name="dcterms:modified" content="2019-03-29T04:36:39Z"/>
<meta name="Last-Modified" content="2019-03-29T04:36:39Z"/>

<meta name="modified" content="2019-03-29T04:36:39Z"/>
<meta name="Content-Length" content="5721559"/>
<meta name="tiff:ImageWidth" content="1920"/>
<meta name="xmpDM:duration" content="2.64"/>
<meta name="Content-Type" content="video/mp4"/>
<title/>
</head>
<body/></html>

using exiftool, GPS etc metadata were there...

I'm able to extract lat/long from the AppleGPSCoordinatesBox that is stored in UserData in the file you attached. Is this sufficient? Or are you finding coordinates elsewhere?

0: X-Parsed-By : org.apache.tika.parser.DefaultParser
0: X-Parsed-By : org.apache.tika.parser.mp4.MP4Parser

Thank you so much! I have tested with tika-app-1.21-20190502.215314-47.jar for 1.mp4 and getting the below:

But when testing mov file the gps information is still not there. See attached mov file and the output below:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

When testing with jpg, there are other GPS fields see below, I wonder if it would be better the field names and format of the content to be consistent with those parsed for image files? so it would work for other applications that are using Tika such as Solr? Thank you!

Thank you for the .mov file. I'll take a look. I'll get back to you on the other metadata items...some time today, early next week.

I'm not having much luck...
I can't find gps coordinates with our current mp4parser, and I get a runtime exception with:

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.mp4parser</groupId>
            <artifactId>isoparser</artifactId>
            <version>1.9.36</version>
        </dependency>

I am able to get the coordinates with:

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.jcodec</groupId>
            <artifactId>jcodec</artifactId>
            <version>0.2.3</version>
        </dependency>

com.apple.quicktime.location.ISO6709: -35.2844+149.1214+573.764/
com.apple.quicktime.make: Apple
com.apple.quicktime.model: iPad Pro
com.apple.quicktime.software: 12.2
com.apple.quicktime.creationdate: 2019-05-01T10:42:08+1000

The bsd2 license is compatible with Apache...yay!, but I'd need to figure out how to get all the other metadata we're getting with our mp4parser...

Tantalizingly close on the 1.mp4:

        File f = new File("C:/data/1.mp4");
        MP4Util.Movie m = MP4Util.parseFullMovie(f);
        for (MetaBox metaBox : (MetaBox[])NodeBox.findAll(m.getMoov(), MetaBox.class, MetaBox.fourcc())) {
            for (Map.Entry<Integer, MetaValue> e : metaBox.getItunesMeta().entrySet()) {
                System.out.println("itunes: "+e.getKey() + " : "+e.getValue());
            }
            for (Map.Entry<String, MetaValue> e : metaBox.getKeyedMeta().entrySet()) {
                System.out.println("general: "+e.getKey() + " : "+e.getValue());
            }
        }

        UdtaBox metaBox = NodeBox.findFirst(m.getMoov(), UdtaBox.class, UdtaBox.fourcc());

        for (Box box : metaBox.getBoxes()) {
            System.out.println(box.getFourcc());
        }

The coordinate string is in the "©xyz" box...I just can't figure out how to get the raw bytes/string.
https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/2992b0321e5907900aeda40e56eea040442e20c6a6eb0e95cf8007aa@%3Cdev.tika.apache.org%3E
Many thanks Tim for your help and update!

Is it related to https://github.com/jcodec/jcodec/tree/master/src/main/java/org/jcodec/containers/mp4/boxes ?
I submitted an issue here too: https://github.com/jcodec/jcodec/issues/372
Would the solution here help: https://github.com/jcodec/jcodec/issues/372 Thanks!

Y. That's fantastic! It'll take some time to migrate over to jcodec...if that's where we're headed...certainly not in time for the 1.21 release.

Let me take a look and see what I can do over the next few weeks. We'll want to run jcodec against all of our mp4s in our regression corpus to make sure that we're not losing anything and/or taking an unacceptable performance hit. The responsiveness of the jcodec team is heart warming...
That sounds great! Thank you, you are a star! : ) Let me know if I can help or if there is any other option or direction we can investigate.

Any news? Thanks Tim!
Also see here: https://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/lucene-solr-user/201905.mbox/%3CCAK3r-hPvrRVR9uPnBj3vSHRm4UO1VxQmrDyqAu_YXbK6oLqo2Q%40mail.gmail.com%3E
No...sorry...no news. Thank you for the link. I'll take a look!
